intro: Corydalis lathyroides, commonly known as the broadleaf corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a suitable candidate for woodland gardens. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated for both horticultural and traditional uses.
